feature_description: Extract content matching specific patterns (e.g., regex)
env_setup:
Initial clean-up
Execute rm -r ~/Desktop/oi/* to start with fresh test directory.
mkdir -p ~/Desktop/oi/data
cd ~/Desktop/oi/data
cat > contacts.txt << 'EOL'
John Doe, john.doe@example.com, (555) 123-4567, Marketing
Jane Smith, jane.smith@company.org, (555) 987-6543, Engineering
Bob Johnson, bob.j@email.net, (555) 555-1212, Sales
Alice Williams, alice@website.com, (555) 333-4444, Engineering
Mike Brown, mbrown@email.org, (555) 777-8888, Marketing
Sarah Miller, sarah.miller@company.org, (555) 222-3333, HR
Tom Wilson, twilson@example.com, (555) 444-5555, Sales
David Clark, dclark@engineering.com, (555) 666-7777, Engineering
EOL
prompt: Extract all email addresses of people who work in Engineering from the contacts.txt file in the data folder.
expected_behaviour: The agent should use a command like `grep "Engineering" ~/Desktop/oi/data/contacts.txt | grep -o '[[:alnum:]._%+-]\+@[[:alnum:].-]\+\.[[:alpha:]]\{2,\}'` or similar approach to extract only the email addresses associated with Engineering department. The output should include jane.smith@company.org, alice@website.com, and dclark@engineering.com. Achieving a similar outcome using any reasonable method is perfectly acceptable.
